SENT.plain: To evaluate platelet accumulation in carotid atherosclerotic lesions semiquantitatively, a dual-tracer technique was applied, using In-111 platelets and Tc-99m human serum albumin
With this approach, we investigated the ratio of radioactivity in In-111 platelets deposited on the vascular wall to those circulating in the blood pool, platelet accumulation index ( PAI )
This study included 12 normal subjects and 25 patients with ischemic cerebrovascular disease (CVD)
Angiographic abnormalities were observed at 34 of 50 carotid bifurcations in the CVD patients
The mean PAI value was significantly higher at the carotid bifurcations with angiographic abnormality than at the normal ones (p less than 0.001)
Furthermore, elevations of mean PAI were prominent at the lesions with severe stenosis or ulceration

The degree of platelet accumulation was well demonstrated by this technique, which can also yield information on thrombogenicity and efficiency of antiplatelet therapy in carotid atherosclerotic disease
